quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Color and Center
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, navel, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The heart center located at the center of the chest is this color and controls the circulatory system, heart, lungs and entire chest area.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emerald Green

questions.question: German and English have a lot in common, because they both belong to the group of Germanic languages. How is the question Wie alt sind Sie? translated into English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: How old are you?

questions.question: The brow center is associated with a persons extra-sensory perception and inner vision.  It is represented by this color.
How is the German word Arztin translated into English?
Chakras are centers for this intangible quality.
What is the English equivalent of the German phrase Woher kommen Sie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Where do you come from?

questions.question: If I wanted to say the word pencil in French, what would I say?
Which German word means knowledge in English?
The hara, located approximately three inches below the navel, also know as this chakra.
The German noun Frage means question in English.
What is the word for table in French?
This color is used to heal the solar-plexus, also known as the power center.
What color would we nedd to heal the soul?
How many major chakras are there?
How do you say cat in French?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Word and French
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, astra, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Julius Caesar once said veni, vidi, vici. What did he mean?

options.text: To win is to see yourself winning
A good enemy is a dead enemy
A friend in need is a friend indeed
I came, I saw, I conquered

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I came, I saw, I conquered

questions.question: What does Ad astra per aspera mean in English?

options.text: Humankind aspires to reach the stars

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To the stars through hardships

questions.question: What does the Latin phrase Quidquid latine dictum sit, altum videtur mean?

options.text: Latin is the mother of all languages
Every wise man should speak Latin
Anything said in Latin sounds profound
You cannot see the truth, until you learn Latin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anything said in Latin sounds profound

questions.question: You’re in France and you want to tell someone that he has a nice tie. What is the word for “tie?”
What is the word for egg in French?
If your business partner says pacta sunt servanda, what does he/she mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Agreements must be honoured.

questions.question: What is the French word for sea?
What does Vae Victis mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woe to the conquered

questions.question: Which of these is the French word for peace?
How does one say cup in French?
Watch out! The road is under _____________.
What is vir in Latin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A man

questions.question: What is the French word for snow?
To whom can you say Cura te ipsum!?

options.text: To a policeman who arrests you
To your partner, expressing your love
To a beggar, when you dont have any money
To a doctor, when you do not agree with his/her diagnosis

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To a doctor, when you do not agree with his/her diagnosis

questions.question: Count to five in French: un, deux, trois, quatre, ____. What is the missing number?

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Proverb and Missing
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, locuta, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the missing part of the saying Make a silk purse out of a ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sows ear

questions.question: What is the missing part of the proverb Hatred is as blind as ...?
How can Nemo sine vitio est be translated into English?

options.text: No-one is a judge in his own case

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No one is without fault

questions.question: What is the missing word in the popular proverb A stitch in time saves ...?
What does Roma locuta, causa finita est mean?

options.text: Rome wasnt built in a day.
Rome has spoken, the discussion is finished.
When in Rome, do as the Romans do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rome has spoken, the discussion is finished.

questions.question: Complete the following proverb: Learn to walk before you ...
What is the missing word from the popular saying A burnt child dreads the ...?
What is the end of the proverb Two wrongs dont make ...?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A right

questions.question: What is the missing part of the proverb, The ... wounds more than a lance?
What is the meaning of sapiens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wise, reasonable

questions.question: When they refer to future events in writing, some people use DV which stands for Deo volente. What does it mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By Gods will

questions.question: Complete the popular proverb: Tall oaks grow from ...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little acorns

questions.question: What is the missing word of the proverb: A loaded ... makes no noise?
Finish the proverb: Blood is thicker than ...
When is it proper to say Nunc est bibendum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At a party

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Dionysus and Word
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, festival, creatures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Dendrites is one of the epithets used for god Dionysus.
These mythological half-man and half-goat creatures, which roamed the woods and mountains, were companions of Dionysus.
Which word refers to the ancient Greek songs, performed by a chorus in honor of the Greek god, Dionysus?
Was the lime tree goddess Aphrodites sacred tree?
According to Greek mythology, who was Adonia?

options.text: The name of a festival to celebrate Adonis and Aphrodite

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The name of a festival to celebrate Adonis and Aphrodite

questions.question: Which word refers to the ecstatic female worshippers of god Dionysos?
Which one of these goddesses is NOT similar to Aphrodite in some way?
Which word refers to the eating of raw flesh, a common practice in Dionysian worship?
God Dionysus is viewed as the promoter of civilization, a lawgiver, and lover of peace.
Which one of these names is not one of goddess Aphrodites surnames?
Anthesteria, a festival in honour of Dionysus, celebrated the maturing of the wine stored at the previous vintage, and the beginning of spring.
Which one of these animals was NOT sacred for Aphrodite?
In both Greek and Roman mythology Dionysus is known by what other name?
Within the Olympian tradition, Dionysos was said to be the son of Zeus and which mortal woman?
Worshippers of god Dionysus often wore what type of attire over their shoulders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fawn skin

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Woman and Portrait
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, sarah, humanities. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the Lithuanian god of the sky, earth, sea and all living creatures who decided to punish mankind and sent to the Earth the Spirit of water and the Spirit of wind?

She was arguably the most educated and most famous woman of the 17th century. She spoke Latin, modern European languages, Greek, Hebrew, Arabic, Syriac, Aramaic, and Ethiopian.  She also excelled in art, music and literature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anna Maria van Schurman

questions.question: This Swiss Neoclassicist painter was chosen to paint the portrait of Monsignor Nevroni, bishop of Como, before she turned 12.  Later, she became a distinguished portrait painter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Angelica Kauffmann

questions.question: What was the name of the Lithuanian god that can be compared to the Creek god of underworld, Hades?
In Greek mythology the Cyclopes were the so called Olympians masons. They built the marvellous palace of the gods at the top of the highest mountain in Greece - Mount Olympus.
What was the name of the mythological statue in which Pygmalion fell in love and eventually the statue became a woman?
The themes of this artist are feminist and political, depicting literary-historical figure groups and decorative female heads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marie Spartali Stillman

questions.question: This woman is referred to as the the most outstanding woman goldsmith of her generation . But this was not by chance - she was the daughter of the famous English silversmith Simon Pantin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Godfrey

questions.question: Born in Barrow, Suffolk she studied to become one of the most important portrait painters in the 17th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Beale

questions.question: In her twenties, this Dutch painter became the only female member of the Haarlem painters guild and quickly adopted students of her own.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judith Leyster

questions.question: She is the only Flemish woman to have specialized in still-life painting as early as the beginning of the 17th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clara Peeters

questions.question: Although she was very young in 1876,  she had great success painting the portrait of Sarah Bernhardt.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louise Abbema

questions.question: She was the predecessor of Madame Tussaud. She modelled wax figures of famous people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patience Wright

questions.question: Why did Phaethon take Apollos chariot and ride off across the sky?

options.text: He wanted to take the place of his father Helios.
His mother Clymene drove him to take his fathers chariot.
He wanted to impress the Greek goddess Aphrodite because he was in love with her.
He was taunted about his origin by Epaphus, a son of Zeus.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was taunted about his origin by Epaphus, a son of Zeus.

questions.question: Born in London, she became the most important woman in the silver trade.  She and her husband made their reputation with silver in the popular French rococo style.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louisa Courtauld

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Language and Guardians
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, guardians, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

This language, spoken by the Sephardic Jews, is a combination of Hebrew and Spanish.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Mexico

questions.question: In how many countries is Spanish the official language?
According to Greek myths, this was the first robot which was made by Hephaestus to protect Crete.
This is the goddess of eternal youth, the guardian of the golden apples of youth in the Scandinavian mythology.
What did the Royal Spanish Academy rule in 1994?

options.text: English words would not be accepted into the Spanish language.
The consonants CH and LL would not be considered separate letters.
Spanish should be the official language of Spain.
The term Castilian would not be used.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The consonants CH and LL would not be considered separate letters.

questions.question: In what country in Africa is Spanish the official language?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Equatorial Guinea

questions.question: Spanish is one of the six official languages of the U.N.
In Finnish myths the Sampo was a magic artifact made by the blacksmith IImarinen for the sorceress Louhi of Pohjola. What kind of object was this artifact?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a mill

questions.question: According to a Polish legend, which city in Poland was named after a hero who defeated a fearful dragon?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Royal Spanish Academy

questions.question: Besides Espanol, Spanish language is also called Castellano.
